member.name: IMpeg2Demultiplexer.CreateOutputPin

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The CreateOutputPin method creates a new output pin on the Demux.

member.param: Pointer to an structure that specifies the media type information for the new pin.
Pointer to a wide character string that specifies a name for the new pin. The maximum length is 128 characters, including the NULL terminator.
Address of a variable that receives a pointer to the pin's interface.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible return values include the following.

member.name: IMpeg2Demultiplexer.DeleteOutputPin

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The DeleteOutputPin method deletes the specified output pin.

member.param: The friendly name of the pin as specified when the pin was created in a call to CreateOutputPin.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMpeg2Demultiplexer.SetOutputPinMediaType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetOutputPinMediaType method updates the media type of the specified output pin. (DirectX 9.0 and later.)

member.param: The friendly name of the pin as specified when the pin was created in a call to CreateOutputPin.
Pointer to an structure that specifies the new media type information for the pin.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

This interface is implemented on the MPEG-2 Demultiplexer filter (Demux) and is used in both program stream mode and transport stream mode. It is called by applications or other filters to create, configure and delete output pins on the Demux. This interface is not exposed when the filter is playing back a file (pull-mode).
